item.title: Nasa on alert as airplane-sized 120-foot asteroid to approach Earth on Christmas eve - The Times of India
item.description:
NASA on Alert as 120-Foot Asteroid Approaches Earth on Christmas Eve

Publication Date: December 2023 | Source: Times of India

NASA is closely monitoring the approach of asteroid (2024 XN1), which is approximately 120 feet wide and is set to pass near Earth on December 24.

  • The asteroid will pass within about 7,217,247 kilometers (4,480,000 miles) of Earth.
  • It will be traveling at a speed of 6.59 kilometers per second (approximately 23,724 kilometers per hour).
  • Other smaller asteroids will also approach Earth in the days leading up to Christmas.
  • No current asteroids tracked pose a threat to Earth.
“Objects approaching within 4.6 million miles and larger than 150 meters are classified as potentially hazardous, though all currently tracked objects pose no threat to our planet.”

This upcoming asteroid event serves as a reminder of NASA's continuous monitoring of near-Earth objects and their potential risks.

item.title: Periods getting shorter in 30s? Is this a matter of concern - The Times of India
item.description:
Periods Getting Shorter in Your 30s? Concerns and Insights

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Recent observations suggest that many women in their 30s are experiencing shorter menstrual cycles, raising questions about potential health implications.

  • Shorter menstrual cycles observed in numerous women
  • Could indicate underlying health issues
  • Importance of consulting healthcare providers
"Changes in menstrual cycles can signal health changes that should not be ignored."

It is essential for women to stay informed about their reproductive health and seek medical advice if they notice significant changes in their cycles.

item.title: "I'll Be Walking Out With You...": R Ashwin's Reply To Virat Kohli's Retirement Post Is Pure Gold - NDTV Sports
item.description:
R Ashwin's Heartfelt Reply to Virat Kohli's Retirement Tribute

Publication Date: December 20, 2024 | Source: NDTV

The cricket community is abuzz with tributes as Ravichandran Ashwin announced his retirement from international cricket. Virat Kohli shared an emotional message reflecting on their shared journey, to which Ashwin responded with warmth.

  • Ashwin retired after the Brisbane Test against Australia.
  • Kohli expressed his emotions and memories of their partnership over 14 years.
  • Ashwin's response highlighted their strong bond and camaraderie.
“Thanks buddy! Like I told you, I will be walking out with you to bat at the MCG.” — R Ashwin

This signals the end of an era for Indian cricket with Ashwin's departure, leaving behind a legacy of excellence.

item.title: Decode Politics: From ‘alarm’ to ‘adoration’, how RSS, BJP evolved in their view of B R Ambedkar - The Indian Express
item.description:
Decode Politics: From ‘alarm’ to ‘adoration’, how RSS, BJP evolved in their view of B R Ambedkar

Publication Date: December 2024 Source: Indian Express

The ongoing political dynamics in India have spotlighted the BJP's shifting stance towards Dr. B R Ambedkar, especially amidst recent tensions in Parliament regarding remarks made by Union Home Minister Amit Shah.

  • The recent showdown in Parliament highlights the BJP's evolving stance on Ambedkar.
  • The BJP seeks to attract all Hindu castes, including Dalits, into its political fold.
  • The party’s engagement with Ambedkar is described as politically expedient, especially in competition with the weakened Congress.
  • Ambedkar's history as a critic of the caste system complicates his place within Hindu nationalist politics.
“The BJP has attempted to bring all Hindu castes, including Dalits, under the fold of Hindutva — constantly redefining its position on Ambedkar.”

This transformation in the BJP's approach to Ambedkar reflects broader changes in India's political landscape and the party’s strategy to unify diverse groups under its ideology.

item.title: Delhi's overall air quality remains ‘severe’, AQI over 450 in some areas - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi's Air Quality Remains ‘Severe’, AQI Over 450 in Some Areas

Date & Source: Dec 20, 2024 08:05 AM IST, Hindustan Times

Delhi's air quality on Thursday plunged into the 'severe plus' category, with a 24-hour average AQI of 451 recorded at 4 pm, according to CPCB data.

  • The overall AQI at around 8 am on Friday in Delhi stood at 434 - what the CPCB classifies as the severe category. Of the 35 monitoring stations listed on the government's Sameer app, Rohini, RK Puram, Sirifort, Dwarka Sector 8, Wazirpur were among those that recorded an AQI of over 450.
  • As per the CPCB, an AQI between 0 and 50 is considered 'good,' 51-100 'satisfactory,' 101-200 'moderate,' 201-300 'poor,' 301-400 'very poor,' 401-450 'severe,' and above 450 'severe plus.'
  • On Thursday, the city saw dangerously high levels of PM2.5, the primary pollutant, with 32 of the 35 monitoring stations recording air quality in the severe plus category. Some areas recorded AQI readings as high as 470. The PM2.5 particles, measuring 2.5 micrometers or less in diameter, pose significant health risks as they can penetrate deep into the lungs when inhaled.
Delhi remains under Stage IV of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP), which includes the most stringent anti-pollution measures. The measures involve a complete ban on construction activities and the entry of non-essential polluting trucks into the city.

The Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) had issued a yellow alert for Friday, warning of very dense fog in some areas. The maximum temperature on Thursday was recorded at 23 degrees Celsius, slightly above the season's normal, while the minimum temperature was five degrees Celsius, three notches below normal, as per IMD.

item.title: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on rising temple-mosque disputes: 'Not acceptable' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat Calls for Harmony Amid Temple-Mosque Disputes

Publication Date: Thursday

Source: PTI

Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) chief Mohan Bhagwat expressed concern over rising temple-mosque disputes, advocating for an inclusive society that emphasizes harmony.

  • Bhagwat criticized individuals seeking to gain leadership by inciting disputes following the Ram Temple construction in Ayodhya.
  • He noted that ongoing rakes of new disputes threaten India's harmony and acceptance of diverse faiths.
  • The Supreme Court recently issued a directive to halt any new suits related to temple-mosque surveys.
  • Bhagwat emphasized that the country operates under the Constitution, dismissing past hegemonic rule.
  • He called for a united identity among all Indians, regardless of religious background.
“We have been living in harmony for a long time. This cannot continue. India needs to show that we can live together.” - Mohan Bhagwat

In conclusion, Bhagwat's remarks underline the importance of maintaining societal harmony and inclusivity in the face of rising tensions over religious sites.

item.title: FIR against Rahul Gandhi is diversionary tactic in response to his protest against Amit Shah: Congress - The Hindu
item.description:
Congress Claims FIR Against Rahul Gandhi is a Diversionary Tactic

Date: December 20, 2024

Source: The Hindu

The Congress party has alleged that the recent FIR against Rahul Gandhi is a diversionary tactic in reaction to his protests against Home Minister Amit Shah's comments on B.R. Ambedkar.

  • Congress general secretary K.C. Venugopal stated that the FIR is a tactic to silence dissent.
  • Venugopal emphasized that defending Ambedkar's legacy is an honour, not a crime.
  • Rahul Gandhi currently faces 26 other FIRs, deemed politically motivated by Congress.
  • The FIR was registered amidst chaotic scenes in Parliament with conflicts between Opposition and BJP members.
The FIR against Sh. @RahulGandhi ji is nothing but a diversionary tactic in response to his staunch protest against the Home Minister. A case against him for defending Babasaheb's legacy is a badge of honour. — K C Venugopal (@kcvenugopalmp) December 19, 2024

Congress leaders assert their commitment to oppose what they label as the casteist regime of the RSS-BJP.

item.title: R Ashwin "Hurt, Unhappy, Deserved Better": Kapil Dev's Explosive Claim - NDTV Sports
item.description:
R Ashwin "Hurt, Unhappy, Deserved Better": Kapil Dev's Explosive Claim

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 Source: NDTV

Kapil Dev has expressed shock and disappointment at R Ashwin's unexpected retirement from international cricket, suggesting he deserved a better farewell.

  • Kapil Dev emphasized that Ashwin's decision to retire was surprising, especially following a draw against Australia.
  • He expressed a sense of hurt seeing Ashwin unhappy, stating a fitting farewell on home soil would have been more appropriate.
  • Kapil highlighted Ashwin's significant contributions to Indian cricket, noting he played 106 Tests and remarked on his unique bowling style.
  • He hopes the BCCI will organize a grand farewell for Ashwin, reinforcing his impact on the sport.
“Only a champion is not insecure, and Ashwin was a champion. He has given us great joy. I wish him all the joy of the world.” - Kapil Dev

In conclusion, Kapil Dev's reflections on Ashwin's career underscore the immense respect and admiration he holds for the player, marking a significant transition in Ashwin's cricket journey.

item.title: Shah Rukh Khan and Aishwarya Rai smile as they record their kids AbRam, Aaradhya Bachchan's performance at school event - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Shah Rukh Khan and Aishwarya Rai attend kids' school event, record performances

Date & Source: Dec 20, 2024 07:33 AM IST - Hindustan Times

Introduction: Shah Rukh Khan and Aishwarya Rai attended a school event where their kids, AbRam Khan and Aaradhya Bachchan, performed on stage. Both stars were seen recording their kids' performances.

  1. Aishwarya and Abhishek's daughter, Aaradhya Bachchan, performed on stage.
  2. Shah Rukh and Gauri's son, AbRam Khan, also performed with Aaradhya.
  3. Aishwarya and Abhishek were seen together at the event, putting rumors about their marriage to rest.
  4. Shah Rukh was accompanied by his wife Gauri and daughter Suhana.
  5. Other celebrities like Shahid Kapoor, Mira Rajput, Kareena Kapoor, and Saif Ali Khan also attended the event.
Shah Rukh was seen dancing with the school kids.

Conclusion: The event was a star-studded affair with many celebrities attending to support their kids. Shah Rukh and Aishwarya were both actively involved in recording their kids' performances.

item.title: US govt shutdown looms ahead of Christmas: What could happen? What’s at stake for workers, services, and - The Times of India
item.description:
US Government Shutdown Looms Ahead of Christmas: Potential Impacts on Workers, Services, and the Economy

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

As the holiday season approaches, the prospect of a government shutdown raises concerns about its effects on federal workers, essential services, and the broader economy.

  • The looming shutdown could impact millions of federal employees, affecting their income and job security.
  • Essential services, including federal assistance programs, may face disruptions, impacting vulnerable populations.
  • The economic toll could result in decreased spending, leading to potential ripple effects on local economies.
  • Budget negotiations continue, leaving uncertainty about the resolution of funding issues.
"A government shutdown during the holiday season could significantly affect families counting on federal support."

In conclusion, a potential government shutdown presents serious risks for workers, vital services, and the economy, particularly during a critical time of year.

item.title: After Ravichandran Ashwin, Floodgates Opened For Big Retirements? Report Says, "Summer Of 2025..." - NDTV Sports
item.description:
After Ravichandran Ashwin, Floodgates Opened For Big Retirements? Report Says, 'Summer Of 2025...'

Publication Date: December 19, 2024 | Source: NDTV

The Indian cricket team is poised for a transition following the retirement of star off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin, leading to speculation about more retirements in the near future.

  • Ashwin has retired after an illustrious career with 537 wickets in 106 Tests.
  • His decision has taken players like Virat Kohli by surprise, while Rohit Sharma was aware beforehand.
  • Reports indicate a potential transitional phase for the Indian team starting after the World Test Championship final in June 2025.
  • Parallels are being drawn to the retirements in 2008, where several senior players left the game in quick succession.
  • Other veterans, including Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, have recently stepped away from T20Is.
"It is unlikely that anyone would openly admit it was a nudge, but there is a perception that this announcement is just the first in a series expected to follow..."

This development may set in motion a significant change for Indian cricket as veteran players reassess their futures in the sport.

item.title: 6 healthy lifestyle changes to adopt for a long life - The Times of India
item.description:
6 Healthy Lifestyle Changes for a Longer Life

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Everyone wants to live a long, fulfilling life, but not everyone knows the secrets to achieving it. Longevity isn’t just about good genes—it’s about making choices that protect our health and boost happiness every day.

  • Adopt mindful eating practices by focusing on how food makes you feel.
  • Incorporate more movement into your daily life, inspired by 'Blue Zones'.
  • Mend relationships with friends and family to combat loneliness.
  • Add more plant-based foods to your diet for health benefits.
  • Prioritize restorative practices like napping and meditation.
  • Develop a strong sense of purpose to promote mental health.
“Loneliness can be as harmful as smoking 15 cigarettes a day.”

By adopting these lifestyle changes, individuals can improve their chances of living longer, healthier, and happier lives.

item.title: Virat Kohli 'leaving India'; cricketer to move to London with Anushka Sharma, kids Vamika, Akaay soon, confirms ex-coach - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Virat Kohli and Family Set to Relocate to London, Confirms Coach

Date: Dec 20, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Rajkumar Sharma, Virat Kohli's childhood coach, has confirmed that Kohli, along with Anushka Sharma and their children, will soon be relocating to London. This move marks a new chapter for the family as Kohli prepares for life post-retirement.

  • Kohli along with his wife Anushka and children Vamika and Akaay will move to London.
  • The family has frequently visited London, where Akaay was born earlier this year.
  • Rajkumar Sharma indicates Kohli has plans to live in the UK permanently post-retirement.
  • Virat continues to focus on his career, with expectations to perform well in upcoming matches.
“Virat is still very fit and not too old to retire. I believe that Virat will play cricket for five more years.” - Rajkumar Sharma

This planned relocation underscores the family's ties to London, as they prepare for a significant lifestyle change amidst Kohli's ongoing cricket career.

item.title: Infosys, Wipro ADRs end with gains of up to 4% post Accenture results, can Indian IT replicate the move? - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Infosys, Wipro ADRs end with gains of up to 4% post Accenture results, can Indian IT replicate the move?

Date: Dec 20, 2024 Source: CNBC TV18

The US-listed shares (ADRs) of Infosys and Wipro recorded gains of up to 4% after Accenture reported better-than-expected quarterly results and raised its annual guidance.

  • Infosys ADR rose by 3.4%, while Wipro ADR climbed by 2.3%.
  • Accenture's revenue for the first quarter exceeded analyst expectations, leading to a 7% rise in its shares.
  • The company raised its full-year revenue guidance to 4-7% from 3-6%.
  • The BFSI segment of Accenture reported a robust 10% growth sequentially.
  • GenAI bookings reached $1.2 billion, indicating a 20% quarter-on-quarter growth.
  • Despite strong performance, management noted a lack of recovery in client spending, especially in smaller deals.
“The results of Accenture puts the entire Indian IT basket into focus.”

In conclusion, the performance of Accenture may signal potential opportunities for Indian IT firms if they can replicate similar growth trends.

item.title: Pushpa 2 box office collection day 14: Allu Arjun and Rashmika Mandanna’s collects 975 cr by 2nd Thursday - TOI Etimes
item.description:
Pushpa 2 box office collection day 14: Allu Arjun and Rashmika Mandanna’s collects 975 cr by 2nd Thursday morning; to join elusive 1000 crore club soon

Date: 14th Day Box Office Update
Source: Times of India

Pushpa 2, featuring Allu Arjun and Rashmika Mandanna, continues its impressive run at the box office, accumulating a whopping 975 crores by the second Thursday morning. The film is on track to join the prestigious 1000 crore club shortly.

  • Collection of 975 crore by day 14 of release.
  • Film set to cross the 1000 crore mark soon.
  • High anticipation surrounding the film's performance.
“With this performance, Pushpa 2 is expected to become one of the highest-grossing films of all time.”

The remarkable box office performance of Pushpa 2 highlights the growing popularity of regional films and their capacity to achieve monumental success.
